headline.print_headline: Why Help on Tech Is Unbearable

snippet: Worse, just as you suspected, companies know the torture they are putting you through, with cable and mobile service providers the most egregious offenders....
abstract: Data shows that so-called 'tech support rage,' frustration experienced by millions of customers as they contend with byzantine menus and unhelpful scripted responses, is intentionally engineered by companies; businesses often have limited amount of hands-on support to provide, and seek to deter increasingly savvy customers from consuming resources; experts say most egregious culprits are cable and mobile service providers.
